Umineko Project (UP): Erika's seat was the lowest one in rank. In other words, it was at the inferior end of the table.
Steam (ST): Erika's seat was the lowest one in rank. In other words, it was at the inferior end of the table.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカの席は、序列で言うと一番の末席。つまり、下手の正面席。
Russian (RU): Место Эрики было самым низким по рангу. Она сидела в низшем конце стола.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika sentou‐se no assento mais baixo da hierarquia. Ou seja, estava na ponta final da mesa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花的坐席，依序列來講即為末席。也就是桌子下方的正面席。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花的坐席，依序列来讲即为末席。也就是桌子下方的正面席。

Umineko Project (UP): Since Kinzo's seat at the high end of the table was empty, if you turned the whole thing around, it sort of looked like Erika was the host of this dinner...
Steam (ST): Since Kinzo's seat at the high end of the table was empty, if you spun the whole thing around, it sort of looked like Erika was the host of this dinner...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since Kinzo's seat at the high end of the table was empty, if you turned the whole thing around, it sort of looked like Erika was the host of this dinner...
PC Japanese (JP): 上手の正面席である金蔵の席は不在であるため、引っ繰り返して見たならまるで、ヱリカがこの晩餐の主催のようにさえ見えた…。
Russian (RU): Поскольку место Кинзо в высшем конце пустовало, со стороны казалось, будто Эрика была хозяйкой этого ужина...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como o assento de Kinzo, localizado no início da mesa, estava vago, se você a virasse ao contrário, pareceria que Erika era a anfitriã do jantar...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因上方正面席的金藏缺席，所以從反方向看的話，繪梨花看起來甚至像是這場晚餐的主辦者…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因上方正面席的金藏缺席，所以从反方向看的话，绘梨花看起来甚至像是这场晚餐的主办者…。

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "Well then, everyone. I would like to begin tonight's dinner, if I may."
Steam (ST): "Well then, everyone. I would like to begin tonight's dinner, if I may."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「それでは皆様。本日の晩餐を始めさせていただきたいと思います。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それでは皆様。本日の晩餐を始めさせていただきたいと思います」
Russian (RU): "Что ж, дамы и господа. С вашего позволения я бы хотел начать сегодняшний ужин."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Muito bem, pessoal. Se me permitem, eu gostaria de dar início ao jantar desta noite."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那麼，諸位。就此開始本日的晚餐吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那么，诸位。就此开始本日的晚餐吧。」

Umineko Project (UP): After Gohda's announcement, dinner began with the almost customary applause.
Steam (ST): After Gohda's announcement, dinner began with the applause that had become almost customary.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田が挨拶すると、半ば恒例となった拍手から晩餐はスタートする。
Russian (RU): После его объявления ужин начался с почти общепринятых аплодисментов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após o pronunciamento de Gohda, o jantar teve início com os aplausos de sempre.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鄉田致完詞，已成半個慣例地拍了拍手，示意晚餐開始。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 乡田致完词，已成半个惯例地拍了拍手，示意晚餐开始。

Umineko Project (UP): It was finally the beginning of the dinner orchestra conducted by Toshiro Gohda.
Steam (ST): It was finally the beginning of the dinner orchestra conducted by Toshiro Gohda.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was finally the beginning of the dinner orchestra conducted by Toshiro Gohda.
PC Japanese (JP): いよいよ、指揮者トシロー・ゴーダによる、ディナーオーケストラの開幕だ。
Russian (RU): Наконец настало время обеденного оркестра с Тоширо Годой в роли дирижёра.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Finalmente tinha início o jantar orquestral conduzido por Toshiro Gohda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由指揮——俊朗·鄉田獻上的晚宴管弦樂會終於拉開了帷幕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由指挥——俊朗·乡田献上的晚宴管弦乐会终于拉开了帷幕。

Umineko Project (UP): Sitting at such a majestic dinner table was no everyday thing for these people by any means, except for those in Krauss's immediate family.
Steam (ST): Except for Krauss's household, sitting at such a majestic dinner table was no everyday thing for these people by any means.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Except for Krauss's household, sitting at such a majestic dinner table was no everyday thing for these people by any means.
PC Japanese (JP): このような豪華な晩餐の席は、蔵臼一家を除けば、決して一般的なものではない。
Russian (RU): За исключением семьи Краусса, такие величественные приёмы для них не были повседневными.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sentar‐se à tamanha mesa de jantar magistral não era algo ordinário para nenhum dos ali presentes, exceto por Krauss, que era a senhoria da casa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此等豪華的晚宴，除去藏臼一家，無論對誰都絕非稀鬆平常之物。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此等豪华的晚宴，除去藏臼一家，无论对谁都绝非稀松平常之物。

Umineko Project (UP): However, they were all used to it and acted as though this was completely normal.
Steam (ST): However, they were all used to this event and acted as though it was completely normal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, they were all used to it and acted as though this was completely normal.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、彼らは慣れているから当たり前のように振舞える。
Russian (RU): Но все они привыкли к ним и вели себя как ни в чём не бывало.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, todos já estavam acostumados a agir como se tal acontecimento fosse completamente normal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只不過，由於他們已經習慣了，所以都在舉止自然地享用著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只不过，由于他们已经习惯了，所以都在举止自然地享用着。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Again, if anyone was to be surprised, it should have been Erika.
Steam (ST): ...Once again, if anyone was to be surprised, it should have been Erika.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……驚くべきは、またしてもヱリカだった。
Russian (RU): ......Опять же, если кто и должен был быть удивлён, так это Эрика.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se houvesse alguém surpreso, esta pessoa só poderia ser Erika.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……令人吃驚的，又是繪梨花。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……令人吃惊的，又是绘梨花。

Umineko Project (UP): And yet, she showed no surprise at this dinner, and acted with composure, blending in with everyone else.
Steam (ST): And yet, she showed no signs of amazement at this dinner and acted with composure, blending in with everyone else.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And yet, she showed no surprise at this dinner and acted with composure, blending in with everyone else.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女はこのような晩餐であっても、何も驚かず、周りに合わせて落ち着きある振る舞いを見せている。
Russian (RU): Однако она не удивилась такому ужину и вела себя сдержанно, не отличаясь от остальных.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, ela não demonstrou qualquer expressão de surpresa diante do jantar, e comportou‐se com compostura, misturado‐se aos demais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 即便面對這等排場的晚宴，她也絲毫沒被嚇到，融入周圍，一舉一動沉穩從容。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 即便面对这等排场的晚宴，她也丝毫没被吓到，融入周围，一举一动沉稳从容。

Umineko Project (UP): ......There wasn't even a sliver of the fear one might expect from someone who had wandered here like a lost puppy.
Steam (ST): ...There wasn't even a sliver of the fear one might expect from someone who had wandered here like a lost puppy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……迷い込んだ子犬のような怯えは、微塵も感じられなかった。
Russian (RU): ......Ни тени страха со стороны того, кто забрёл сюда как потерянный щенок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não havia qualquer traço do pavor que seria esperado de alguém de fora, que caíra de paraquedas como um filhotinho perdido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……一點點都感覺不到，那種小狗誤入陌生場所時所顯露的驚恐。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……一点点都感觉不到，那种小狗误入陌生场所时所显露的惊恐。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): ".........What a mysterious child. She doesn't seem the least bit flustered over the Ushiromiya family's grandest dinner of the year."
Steam (ST): "......What an odd child. She doesn't seem the least bit flustered by the Ushiromiya family's grandest dinner of the year."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........She's a strange child. She doesn't seem the least bit flustered over the Ushiromiya family's grandest dinner of the year."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………不思議な子ですね。右代宮家の、一年間でもっとも豪華な晩餐を前に、何も取り乱さないとは。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………不思議な子ですね。右代宮家の、一年間でもっとも豪華な晩餐を前に、何も取り乱さないとは」
Russian (RU): ".........Странная девочка. Нисколько не взволнована величайшим ежегодным ужином семьи Уширомия."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Ela é mesmo uma criança intrigante. Ela não parece estar minimamente afobada diante do grandioso jantar da família Ushiromiya."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………真是個不可思議的孩子呢。面對右代宮家一年中最為豪華的晚餐，竟絲毫不顯得驚慌。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………真是个不可思议的孩子呢。面对右代宫家一年中最为豪华的晚餐，竟丝毫不显得惊慌。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): "Kids these days have nerves of steel. ...Definitely not something I dislike."
Steam (ST): "Kids these days have nerves of steel. ...Definitely not something I dislike."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「最近の子は肝が据わってるわ。…嫌いじゃないわ、そういうの。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「最近の子は肝が据わってるわ。…嫌いじゃないわ、そういうの」
Russian (RU): "В наше время у детей стальные нервы. ...Мне это определённо нравится."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "As crianças de hoje em dia têm nervos de aço. ...Não posso dizer que tal coisa me desagrade."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「最近的小孩都挺大膽的。…我倒並不討厭這種類型。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「最近的小孩都挺大胆的。…我倒并不讨厌这种类型。」

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "Furudo‐san, are you accustomed to meals like this...? I'm impressed that you look so composed."
Steam (ST): "Is Furudo-san used to meals such as this one...? She seems to be quite composed."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Is Furudo-san used to meals such as this one...? She seems to be quite composed."
PC Japanese (JP): 「古戸さんは、こういう食事にはなれているのですか…？　大した落ち着きようだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「古戸さんは、こういう食事にはなれているのですか…？　大した落ち着きようだ」
Russian (RU): "Фурудо привыкла к таким банкетам?.. Она выглядит такой собранной."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Furudo‐san, você está acostumada a refeições desse tipo...? Estou impressionado com sua compostura."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「古戶小姐是否是對這種餐宴習以為常了呢…？好是從容不迫。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「古户小姐是否是对这种餐宴习以为常了呢…？好是从容不迫。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "No kiddin'. She's a real pro. Heck, I still get confused about which fork I'm supposed to use next. Yeah...was it this one, or this one...? Waha{0}ha{0}ha{0}haha!"
Steam (ST): "No kiddin'. She looks really experienced. Heck, I still get confused about which fork I'm supposed to use next. Hmm, ...was it this one, or this one...? Wahahahahaha!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No kiddin'. She seems very experienced. Heck, I still get confused about which fork I'm supposed to use next. Yeah...was it this one, or this one...? Wahahahahaha!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ホンマやなぁ。ずいぶん手馴れたもんや。わしなんか、未だに次はどのフォークを使えばいいんか混乱するんやで。あー…、こっちやったか、それともこっちやったか…。わはははははっ！」
Russian (RU): "Да уж. У неё, видимо, много опыта. А вот я до сих пор путаю, какую вилку нужно брать следующей. Да... эту или эту?.. Ва‐ха‐ха‐ха‐ха!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Pois é. Ela tá claramente acostumada. Até hoje eu ainda me confundo com qual garfo devo usar a seguir. Sim...seria este? Ou este aqui...? Waha{0}ha{0}ha{0}haha!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「說的是吶。相當熟門熟路。像俺是還沒搞明白接下來該用哪把叉子，腦子都亂了吶。啊——…，是用這把麼？還是用那把呢…？哇哈哈哈哈哈！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「说的是呐。相当熟门熟路。像俺是还没搞明白接下来该用哪把叉子，脑子都乱了呐。啊——…，是用这把么？还是用那把呢…？哇哈哈哈哈哈！」

Umineko Project (UP): Erika had been gracefully eating her hors d'oeuvres, without showing any confusion over the line of utensils in front of her.
Steam (ST): Without showing any confusion over the line of utensils in front of her, Erika gracefully ate her hors d'oeuvres.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Without showing any confusion over the line of utensils in front of her, Erika gracefully ate her hors d'oeuvres.
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカは、ずらりと並べられた食器類に面食らう様子もなく、優雅にオードブルを食べている。
Russian (RU): Нисколько не путаясь в линии столовых приборов перед собой, Эрика изящно съела свои закуски.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika degustava seu {i:hors d'oeuvre} de forma graciosa, sem demonstrar qualquer expressão de confusão diante dos utensílios dispostos à sua frente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花一點都沒有被在面前一字排開的盤子嚇到，優雅地享用著拼盤。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花一点都没有被在面前一字排开的盘子吓到，优雅地享用着拼盘。

Umineko Project (UP): Hideyoshi started joking around with her, gripping a fork in each hand.
Steam (ST): Hideyoshi had started joking around with her, gripping a fork in each hand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Hideyoshi had started joking around with her, gripping a fork in each hand.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな彼女に、秀吉は両手にフォークを握り締めながら滑稽に話し掛ける。
Russian (RU): Хидэёши начал шутить с ней, держа вилку то в одной руке, то в другой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hideyoshi começou a fazer piada, segurando um garfo em cada mão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 秀吉雙手握著叉子，向這樣的她開起了玩笑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 秀吉双手握着叉子，向这样的她开起了玩笑。

Umineko Project (UP): Of course, a president of a company in the food service industry like Hideyoshi would obviously know his table manners.
Steam (ST): Of course, the president of a company in the food service industry like Hideyoshi obviously knew his table manners.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, the president of a company in the food service industry like Hideyoshi would obviously know his table manners.
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、仮にも外食チェーンの社長を務める秀吉がテーブルマナーを身に付けていないはずもない。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, директор компании в отрасли общественного питания не мог не знать застольный этикет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, um presidente de uma companhia que atua no ramo da indústria de serviços alimentícios, como Hideyoshi, obviamente sabia sobre as boas maneiras à mesa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，擔任餐飲連鎖公司的社長的秀吉不可能不懂桌上禮儀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当然，担任餐饮连锁公司的社长的秀吉不可能不懂桌上礼仪。

Umineko Project (UP): However, thinking that Erika must be nervous over this dinner, he had intentionally spoken with a comic tone of voice.
Steam (ST): However, thinking that Erika must be nervous over this dinner, he had intentionally spoken with a comic tone of voice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, thinking that Erika must be nervous over this dinner, he had intentionally spoken with a comic tone of voice.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、さぞやこの晩餐にヱリカが緊張しているだろうと思い、わざとおどけた口調で話しかけているのだ。
Russian (RU): Но думая, что Эрику наверняка нервирует этот ужин, он намеренно говорил комичным тоном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, pensando que Erika poderia estar nervosa por causa do jantar, ele intencionalmente falou em tom cômico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他只不過是想著，繪梨花在這晚餐席上是有點緊張吧，而故意用打趣的口吻向她搭話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他只不过是想着，绘梨花在这晚餐席上是有点紧张吧，而故意用打趣的口吻向她搭话。

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "............You just have to start on the outside and work your way in. ......If that's too much trouble, then just ask for some chopsticks. ......Any self‐respecting Japanese would use chopsticks."
Steam (ST): "......You just have to start on the outside and work your way in. ...If that's a pain, then just ask for some chopsticks. ...If you're Japanese, you've got to love chopsticks."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........You just have to start on the outside and work your way in. ......If that's a pain, then just ask for some chopsticks. ......If you're Japanese, you've got to love chopsticks."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………外側から順に使うだけですし。……面倒だったら、お箸を頼めばいいんです。……日本人ならお箸です。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………外側から順に使うだけですし。……面倒だったら、お箸を頼めばいいんです。……日本人ならお箸です」
Russian (RU): ".........Просто начните с внешней стороны и двигайтесь дальше. ......Если сложно — возьмите палочки для еды. ......Любой японец должен любить их."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Basta seguir utilizando das extremidades para dentro. ......Se for muito complicado, então só peça a alguém por hashis. ......Qualquer bom japonês ama comer com seus hashis."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………只是依從外到裡的順序用罷了。……要是嫌麻煩的話，就去拜託給雙筷子好了。……既然是日本人，那就用筷子。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………只是依从外到里的顺序用罢了。……要是嫌麻烦的话，就去拜托给双筷子好了。……既然是日本人，那就用筷子。」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "Chopsticks are wonderful. Just a single pair, and you can handle any kind of food!"
Steam (ST): "Chopsticks are so great. Just one pair of those, and you can deal with any kind of food!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Chopsticks are so great. Just one pair of those, and you can deal with any kind of food!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「お箸はいいですよっ。これ一膳あれば、どんな料理でも対処デキマス！」
Russian (RU): "Они так прекрасны. Всего одной парой можно съесть абсолютно любое блюдо!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hashis são maravilhosos. Com um único par, você é capaz de lidar com qualquer tipo de comida!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「筷子是好東西喲。只要有一雙筷子，不管什麼料理都有辦法開動！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「筷子是好东西哟。只要有一双筷子，不管什么料理都有办法开动！」

Umineko Project (UP): As soon as she began talking about chopsticks, her eyes started glittering.
Steam (ST): As soon as she began talking about chopsticks, her eyes started glittering.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): お箸の話になった途端に、目をキラキラさせだす。
Russian (RU): Как только она стала говорить о палочках, её глаза заблестели.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim que começou a falar sobre hashis, os olhos de Erika reluziram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一提到筷子，她就雙目放光。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一提到筷子，她就双目放光。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The smile she now showed for the first time was far different from the dignity she had shown before and more like something you'd expect from someone her age.
Steam (ST): ...The smile she now showed for the first time was far different from the dignity she'd displayed before, more like something you'd expect from someone her age.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……さっきまでの貫禄とは程遠い、初めて見せた歳相応な笑顔だった。
Russian (RU): ......Её первая улыбка отличалась от прежнего достойного вида и больше напоминала то, что ожидаешь от человека её возраста.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O sorriso demonstrado por ela agora era completamente diferente da dignidade que ela havia exibido anteriormente, assimilando‐se a algo que você esperaria vindo de alguém da idade dela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……跟之前的尊貴氛圍相距甚遠，繪梨花第一次露出了與其年齡相稱的笑容。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……跟之前的尊贵氛围相距甚远，绘梨花第一次露出了与其年龄相称的笑容。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): "*giggle*. But you'd use a spoon for curry and rice at least, wouldn't you?"
Steam (ST): "*giggle* But even you would use a spoon for curry and rice, wouldn't you?"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......S, sure, of course..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お、おう、もちろんだぜ…。」
Russian (RU): "......Ла... ладно, конечно..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......C‐Claro, é moleza..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……哦、哦——，這是當然嘞…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……哦、哦——，这是当然嘞…」

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica straightened up so much it looked like someone had poked her in the back with a pole.
Steam (ST): Jessica straightened up so much it looked like someone had poked her back with a pole.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Jessica straightened up so much it looked like someone had poked her back with a pole.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香は、背中に棒でも突っ込んだんじゃないかというくらい、ビシッと背筋を伸ばす。
Russian (RU): Джессика выпрямилась так, будто её палкой ударили по спине.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica endireitou sua postura de tal forma que parecia que alguém havia pressionado suas costas contra um poste.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 簡直令人懷疑是不是後背被戳了一棍，朱志香猛地挺直了背。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 简直令人怀疑是不是后背被戳了一棍，朱志香猛地挺直了背。

Umineko Project (UP): ......She had good posture, but it somehow lacked elegance.{n}She looked...well...kind of like a triangle ruler.
Steam (ST): ...She had good posture, but it somehow lacked elegance. She looked...well...kind of like a triangle ruler.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......She had good posture, but it somehow lacked elegance. She looked...well...kind of like a triangle ruler.
PC Japanese (JP): ……良い姿勢ではあるのだが、なぜか優雅じゃない。…なんつーか、三角定規みたいな感じの姿勢だ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……良い姿勢ではあるのだが、なぜか優雅じゃない。{n}…なんつーか、三角定規みたいな感じの姿勢だ。
Russian (RU): ......У неё хорошая осанка, но ей недоставало элегантности.{n}Она выглядела... ну... как треугольная линейка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ela tem boa postura, mas lhe falta elegância.{n}Ela parecia...bem...algum tipo de esquadro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……雖然姿勢不錯，但不知為何就是不優雅。{n}…該怎麼說呢？這姿勢感覺就像是一塊三角板。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……虽然姿势不错，但不知为何就是不优雅。{n}…该怎么说呢？这姿势感觉就像是一块三角板。

Umineko Project (UP): She sat at attention with her gaze fixed straight ahead, tried to bring her food to her mouth despite this, ......and failed miserably.
Steam (ST): She sat at attention with her gaze fixed straight ahead, tried to bring her food to her mouth despite this, ...and failed miserably.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She sat at attention with her gaze fixed straight ahead, tried to bring her food to her mouth despite this, ......and failed miserably.
PC Japanese (JP): 直立不動で、真正面に顔を固定したまま、口に物を運ぼうとするのだから、……うまく行かず、実にみっともない。
Russian (RU): Пристально смотря вперёд, она попробовала так поднести еду ко рту ......и с треском провалилась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela sentou‐se com seu olhar atendo fixado à sua frente, buscando levar a comida à sua boca em tal posição, ......e falhou miseravelmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 筆挺的腰板紋絲不動，臉固定於正前方，……那副食物就是沒法好好送入口的樣子，實在是掉價。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 笔挺的腰板纹丝不动，脸固定于正前方，……那副食物就是没法好好送入口的样子，实在是掉价。

Umineko Project (UP): Dad, who was sitting next to her, suddenly realized that something was up.
Steam (ST): Dad, who was sitting next to her, suddenly realized that something was up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Dad, who was sitting next to her, suddenly realized that something was up.
PC Japanese (JP): それにふと気付く、隣の席の親父。
Russian (RU): Папа, сидящий рядом с ней, вдруг заметил, что что‐то не так.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Meu pai, que estava sentado ao lado dela, percebeu que algo não estava certo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鄰座我老爸的注意力當即就被她吸引過去了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 邻座我老爸的注意力当即就被她吸引过去了。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "Hm? What is it, Jessica‐chan? Your stomach hurt??"
Steam (ST): "Hmm? What's wrong, Jessica-chan? Stomachache??"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hm? What is it, Jessica-chan? Your stomach hurt??"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ん？　どうしたんだ、朱志香ちゃん。腹でも痛ぇのか？？」
Russian (RU): "Хм? В чём дело, Джессика? Живот заболел?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hm? O que foi isso, Jessica‐chan? Está com dor de barriga?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯？怎麼啦，朱志香？是肚子疼嗎？？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯？怎么啦，朱志香？是肚子疼吗？？」

Umineko Project (UP): Jessica turned bright red. ......Ah, sorry, I can't help myself...
Steam (ST): Jessica turned bright red. ...Ah, sorry, I can't help myself...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 真っ赤になる朱志香。……あぁ、悪ィ、俺は無理だ。
Russian (RU): Джессика покраснела. ......А‐а, извини, ничего не могу с собой поделать...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Jessica ficou em vermelho‐vivo. ......Ah, desculpa, eu não presto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朱志香的臉“唰”地一下紅了。……啊——，抱歉，我忍不住了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 朱志香的脸“唰”地一下红了。……啊——，抱歉，我忍不住了。

Umineko Project (UP): We laughed our heads off.{n}Jessica protested, still bright red.{n}Aunt Natsuhi scolded us for not behaving ourselves.
Steam (ST): We laughed our heads off. Jessica protested, still bright red. Aunt Natsuhi scolded us for being too improper.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We laughed our heads off. Jessica protested, still bright red. Natsuhi oba-san scolded us for being too improper.
PC Japanese (JP): げらげら笑い転げる俺たち。真っ赤になって抗議する朱志香。はしたないと叱る夏妃伯母さん。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): げらげら笑い転げる俺たち。{n}真っ赤になって抗議する朱志香。{n}はしたないと叱る夏妃伯母さん。
Russian (RU): Мы разразились смехом.{n}Джессика, всё ещё с красным лицом, возмутилась.{n}Тётя Нацухи отругала нас за неподобающее поведение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós rolamos de rir.{n}Jessica protestou, ainda vermelha.{n}E a tia Natsuhi nos repreendeu pelo nosso comportamento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 哈哈哈地捧腹大笑的我們。{n}滿面通紅地抗議的朱志香。{n}斥責她沒規矩的夏妃伯母。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 哈哈哈地捧腹大笑的我们。{n}满面通红地抗议的朱志香。{n}斥责她没规矩的夏妃伯母。

Umineko Project (UP): In the end, no matter how much we tried to smooth it over, we were who we were.{n}We couldn't act like we were anything else.
Steam (ST): Well, no matter how much we try to smooth it over, we are who we are. We couldn't pretend any longer.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Well, no matter how much we try to smooth it over, we are who we are. We couldn't act like we were anything else.
PC Japanese (JP): ま、俺たちがどう取り繕うと、俺たちは俺たち。それ以上のフリは出来やしなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ま、俺たちがどう取り繕うと、俺たちは俺たち。{n}それ以上のフリは出来やしなかった。
Russian (RU): Что ж, мы те, кто мы есть.{n}У нас не получалось вести себя иначе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No fim, não importa o quanto a gente tente aliviar as coisas, somos quem somos.{n}Não conseguimos agir como se fôssemos outro alguém.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不管我們怎麼粉飾，我們就是我們。{n}沒法裝出更高貴的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不管我们怎么粉饰，我们就是我们。{n}没法装出更高贵的样子。

Umineko Project (UP): Still, that laughter really did help us to relax.
Steam (ST): Still, that laugh really did help us to relax.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Still, that laugh really did help us to relax.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、その笑いのお陰で俺たちもリラックスできたのは確かだ。
Russian (RU): Впрочем, смех сильно помог нам расслабиться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No fim, as risadas nos ajudaram a relaxar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，拜她鬧出的小笑話所賜，我們也都的的確確地得到了放鬆。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，拜她闹出的小笑话所赐，我们也都的的确确地得到了放松。

Umineko Project (UP): We had been so concerned about the guest getting nervous that we had grown even more nervous ourselves.
Steam (ST): We were so concerned about the guest getting nervous, we'd gotten even more nervous ourselves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We were so concerned about the guest getting nervous that we had grown even more nervous ourselves.
PC Japanese (JP): 客人が緊張していないか気遣うあまり、一番緊張していたのは自分たちだったのだ。
Russian (RU): Мы были так озадачены тем, что гостья нервничает, что сами нервничали куда больше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ficamos tão preocupados da convidada estar ficando nervosa que nós mesmos acabamos ficando ainda mais nervosos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於過分擔心客人是否緊張，結果最緊張的，反而是我們自己。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于过分担心客人是否紧张，结果最紧张的，反而是我们自己。

Umineko Project (UP): The lively chatter spread from where we were sitting at the center of the long table to both ends, and ultimately, the dinner went even more smoothly than usual...
Steam (ST): Our chatter from the center of this long table spread to both ends, and ultimately, the dinner went even more smoothly than usual...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Our chatter from the center of this long table spread to both ends, and ultimately, the dinner went even more smoothly than usual...
PC Japanese (JP): 長い食卓の真ん中に座る俺たちの騒ぎは両端に広がり、やがていつも以上に、和やかな晩餐となるのだった…。
Russian (RU): Наша болтовня с центра длинного стола распространилась на обоих концах, и в конце концов ужин пошёл даже более плавно, чем обычно...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A animada conversa se espalhou do ponto central onde estávamos sentados até ambos os limites da mesa, e assim o jantar transcorreu de forma muito mais descontraída que o normal...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 坐在長長飯桌正中央的我們的歡快談笑朝兩端擴展，沒多久，這頓晚餐就變得比以往要更加和樂融融…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 坐在长长饭桌正中央的我们的欢快谈笑朝两端扩展，没多久，这顿晚餐就变得比以往要更加和乐融融…。

Umineko Project (UP): With some delicious cheese and coffee, our peaceful meal came to an end.
Steam (ST): With some delicious cheese and coffee, our peaceful meal came to an end.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With some delicious cheese and coffee, our peaceful meal came to an end.
PC Japanese (JP): 美味しいチーズとコーヒーで、和やかな食事は締めくくられた。
Russian (RU): На вкусном сыре и кофе наш мирный ужин подошёл к концу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Junto à deliciosos queijos e um pouco de café, nossa pacífica refeição chegou ao seu fim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 美味的奶酪與咖啡給這頓和樂融融的聚餐拉下了帷幕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 美味的奶酪与咖啡给这顿和乐融融的聚餐拉下了帷幕。

Umineko Project (UP): Gohda won unanimous acclaim and was praised for his skill by all present......
Steam (ST): Gohda won unanimous acclaim and was praised for his skill by all present...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Gohda won unanimous acclaim and was praised for his skill by all present......
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田は満場の喝采を受けて、その腕前を一同に讃えられるのだった……。
Russian (RU): Года заработал единодушное признание, и все присутствующие высоко оценили его мастерство......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gohda foi unanimemente aclamado e elogiado por todos pelas habilidades que apresentou......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鄉田獲得了滿堂喝彩，眾人一同讚揚著他的廚藝……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 乡田获得了满堂喝彩，众人一同赞扬着他的厨艺……。

Umineko Project (UP): After a short period of harmony following the meal, it was decided that we would return to the guesthouse.
Steam (ST): After a short period of harmony following the meal, it was decided that we would return to the guesthouse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After a short period of harmony following the meal, it was decided that we would return to the guesthouse.
PC Japanese (JP): 食後の団欒のひと時を経て、俺たちはゲストハウスへ戻ることになった。
Russian (RU): После короткого гармоничного перерыва, последовавшего за ужином, было решено вернуться в домик для гостей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após um curto período de harmonia que perdurou durante a refeição, foi decidido que deveríamos voltar para a casa de hóspede.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 飯後一家團聚，談笑了一會兒後，我們決定回賓館。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 饭后一家团聚，谈笑了一会儿后，我们决定回宾馆。

Umineko Project (UP): Normally, dinner tended to have a very dark atmosphere about it, and the adults would often move right on to the family conference with the same dark atmosphere.
Steam (ST): Normally, dinner tended to have a very dark atmosphere about it, and the adults would often keep that mood as they moved straight on to the family conference.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Normally, dinner tended to have a very dark atmosphere about it, and the adults would often move right on to the family conference with the same dark atmosphere.
PC Japanese (JP): 普段なら、晩餐の空気は大抵気まずく、その気まずさの延長のような感じで、大人たちはそのまま親族会議に入ることが多い。
Russian (RU): Как правило, ужин проходил в довольно мрачной обстановке, и взрослые часто переходили прямо к семейному собранию с не менее мрачной обстановкой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Normalmente o jantar tende a ser cercado por uma atmosfera sombria, e os adultos frequentemente seguem para a conferência familiar no mesmo clima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若是平時，晚餐的氣氛大多抑郁沉悶，就猶如這份抑郁氣氛的延伸一般，大人們常常就此直接開始召開親族會議。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若是平时，晚餐的气氛大多抑郁沉闷，就犹如这份抑郁气氛的延伸一般，大人们常常就此直接开始召开亲族会议。

Umineko Project (UP): However, perhaps because this year's dinner had been oddly peaceful, everyone decided to take a break, the adults included.
Steam (ST): However, perhaps because this year's dinner had been oddly peaceful, everyone decided to take a break, the adults included.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, perhaps because this year's dinner had been oddly peaceful, everyone decided to take a break, the adults included.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、珍しく今年の晩餐は和やかだったせいもあってか、大人たちも含め、一度散会することになった。
Russian (RU): Однако — может, потому, что ужин в этом году был, как ни странно, мирным — все, включая взрослых, решили взять перерыв.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, talvez pelo fato do jantar deste ano ter sido estranhamente pacífico, todos decidiram aliviar um pouco, até mesmo os adultos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，大概是有今年晚餐少見的和樂融融的原因吧，包括大人在內，大家都決定了暫且散會。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，大概是有今年晚餐少见的和乐融融的原因吧，包括大人在内，大家都决定了暂且散会。

Umineko Project (UP): After eating, taking a bath, and relaxing while watching TV, I wonder if they'll gather again in the mansion in the middle of all this rain and resume their high‐tension family conference... I'd rather not think about that.
Steam (ST): After eating, taking a bath, and relaxing while watching TV, I wonder if they'll gather again in the mansion with all this rain and resume that high-tension family conference of theirs... I'd rather not think about it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After eating, taking a bath, and relaxing while watching TV, I wonder if they'll gather again in the mansion in the middle of all this rain and resume their high-tension family conference... I'd rather not think about that.
PC Japanese (JP): 晩飯を食って、風呂に入ってテレビ見てくつろいだら、まさかこの雨の中、また屋敷に集まりなおして、ギスギスした親族会議を再開…、というのはちょっと考えたくない話だ。
Russian (RU): После ужина, приняв ванну и отдохнув за просмотром телевизора, они снова в разгар такого ливня соберутся в особняке и возобновят своё напряжённое собрание? Уж лучше не думать об этом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após comerem, tomarem banho e relaxarem assistindo TV, me pergunto se eles ainda vão se reunir novamente na mansão em meio a esse temporal e continuar a conferência familiar de alta tensão... Acho melhor nem pensar sobre isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 吃了晚飯，洗個澡，舒舒服服地看會兒電視，然後竟還要在這大雨之中重新來大屋集合，繼續開令人透不過氣來的親族會議…，這就有點不敢想像了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 吃了晚饭，洗个澡，舒舒服服地看会儿电视，然后竟还要在这大雨之中重新来大屋集合，继续开令人透不过气来的亲族会议…，这就有点不敢想象了。

Umineko Project (UP): Auntie Eva seemed to get very worked up trying to convince the rest to start the family conference right away, but it didn't look like many people agreed with her. The meeting had probably come to a close for the night.
Steam (ST): Apparently, Aunt Eva was getting really worked up, trying to convince the rest to start the family conference right away, but it didn't look like many people agreed with her. They would probably call it quits for the night.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Apparently, Eva oba-san got very worked up trying to convince the rest to start the family conference right away, but it didn't look like many people agreed with her. The meeting had probably come to a close for the night.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんは、すぐにも親族会議を開催しようと息巻いてるようだが、あまり同調者は多くないようだ。多分、今夜はこれでお開きになるだろう。
Russian (RU): Судя по всему, тётя Ева изо всех сил пыталась убедить остальных сразу же начать семейное собрание, но не все с ней согласились. Возможно, встреча на сегодня подошла к концу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Eva parecia bem disposta em tentar convencer os outros de começar a conferência familiar agora mesmo, mas não pareceu que muitos concordariam com sua ideia. A reunião provavelmente se encerraria tarde da noite.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然繪羽姑母在很起勁地提議，盡快開始親族會議，但好像沒多少人贊同。大概，今晚是會就此散了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然绘羽姑母在很起劲地提议，尽快开始亲族会议，但好像没多少人赞同。大概，今晚是会就此散了吧。

Umineko Project (UP): Since they had guesthouse duty, Gohda‐san and Kumasawa‐san were chosen to guide us to the guesthouse.
Steam (ST): Since they had guesthouse duty, Gohda-san and Kumasawa-san were chosen to guide us to the guesthouse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since they had guesthouse duty, Gohda-san and Kumasawa-san were chosen to guide us to the guesthouse.
PC Japanese (JP): ゲストハウスの当番だということで、郷田さんと熊沢さんがゲストハウスまで案内してくれることになった。
Russian (RU): Года и Кумасава были на дежурстве в домике для гостей, поэтому их и выбрали, чтобы проводить нас туда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por terem deveres a cumprir na casa de hóspedes, o Gohda‐san e a Kumasawa‐san foram escolhidos para nos guiar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於要去賓館值班，鄉田與熊澤婆婆將會帶領我們去賓館。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于要去宾馆值班，乡田与熊泽婆婆将会带领我们去宾馆。

Umineko Project (UP): It must be tough for Gohda‐san.
Steam (ST): It's gotta be tough for Gohda-san.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It must be tough for Gohda-san.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田さんも大変だな。
Russian (RU): Тяжело Годе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Deve ser difícil para o Gohda‐san.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鄉田也真夠受的啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 乡田也真够受的啊。

Umineko Project (UP): Even after making and cleaning up such an extravagant dinner, he also has the midnight shift at the guesthouse.
Steam (ST): Even after making and cleaning up such an extravagant dinner, he also has the late night shift at the guesthouse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even after making and cleaning up such an extravagant dinner, he also has the midnight shift at the guesthouse.
PC Japanese (JP): あのすごい晩餐を作って後片付けをして、さらにゲストハウスで深夜勤だなんて。
Russian (RU): Даже после приготовления такого экстравагантного ужина и уборки у него тоже полночная смена в гостевом домике.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo depois de preparar um jantar tão extravagante e arrumar tudo, ele ainda precisa cumprir com o turno da noite na casa de hóspedes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 烹飪了那麼豐盛的晚餐，飯後收拾的人也是他，接著還要去賓館值深夜班。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 烹饪了那么丰盛的晚餐，饭后收拾的人也是他，接着还要去宾馆值深夜班。

Umineko Project (UP): I heard that Kumasawa‐san, old as she was, would be going to sleep soon.
Steam (ST): I heard that Kumasawa-san, old as she was, would be going to sleep soon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I heard that Kumasawa-san, old as she was, would be going to sleep soon.
PC Japanese (JP): 熊沢さんは、さすがに老人なので、もう休むことになっているという。

Umineko Project (UP): "Please allow me to guide all of you to the guesthouse. Erika‐sama, your room has also been prepared."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Allow me to guide everyone to the guesthouse. Erika-sama, your room has also been prepared."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Muito obrigada."

Steam (ST): "Why not rest a bit? Are you sure you feel okay?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「身体怎么样？有没有感到不适？」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "...That's right. I'd totally forgotten, but you nearly drowned and floated here, didn't you, Erika‐chan? It's probably best if you take it easy today and get to bed early."
Steam (ST): "...That's right. I'd totally forgotten, but you nearly drowned and floated here, didn't you, Erika-chan? You'd probably be better off taking it easy and getting to bed early tonight."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...That's right. I'd totally forgotten, but you nearly drowned and floated here, didn't you, Erika-chan? It's probably best if you take it easy today and get to bed early."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…そうだよな。すっかり忘れてたけど、ヱリカちゃんは溺れてて流れ着いたんだよな。今日は無理しねぇで、早く寝た方がいいだろうな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…そうだよな。すっかり忘れてたけど、ヱリカちゃんは溺れてて流れ着いたんだよな。今日は無理しねぇで、早く寝た方がいいだろうな」
Russian (RU): "...О, а ведь точно. Я совсем забыл, ты же плыла сюда и чуть не утонула, Эрика? Наверное, тебе будет лучше не нагружать себя и лечь пораньше."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Pois é. Tinha esquecido completamente que você se afogou e veio boiando até aqui, não foi, Erika‐chan? O melhor a se fazer agora é descansar e ir dormir cedo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…對了。都把這事給徹底忘了，繪梨花是落水漂流到這個島的啊。今天最好就不要勉強，早點睡吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…对了。都把这事给彻底忘了，绘梨花是落水漂流到这个岛的啊。今天最好就不要勉强，早点睡吧。」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I'm perfectly fine. ......On the contrary, I'm so nervous and excited that I doubt I could get to sleep."
Steam (ST): "......I'm perfectly fine. ...On the contrary, I'm so nervous and excited that I doubt I could get any sleep."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Estou perfeitamente bem. ......Pelo contrário, estou tão nervosa e excitada que nem sei se conseguirei dormir."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我完全没事。……比起这个，因紧张与兴奋，我反倒是会睡不着的哦。」

Steam (ST): "Uu-uu-!! Then let's play, let's all play together! Let's play cards!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呜——呜——！！那来玩吧，大家一起玩！玩牌！」

Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Erika's gaze was captured by the portrait of the witch, and she simply stared at it for a while......

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "......Yeah. Supposedly, Dad has a stash of hidden gold worth 20 billion yen, and the hiding place for that gold is written of on this epitaph."
Steam (ST): "...Yeah. Supposedly, Dad has a stash of hidden gold worth 20 billion yen, and this epitaph shows you where that gold's hidden."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): The topic...was the witch's epitaph, which Erika had taken an interest in.

Steam (ST): "......It really is a fascinating riddle. ......He stuck it out in a place where anyone could see it, challenging our intelligence. ......I love that kind of challenge."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………魅力的な謎ですね。………誰にでも見られるところに堂々と張り出し、私たちの知恵に挑戦する。………そういう挑戦、大好きです」

Speaker: Furudo Erika

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............Inheriting that would be almost completely the same as inheriting the Ushiromiya family itself. ...In other words, this riddle of the gold's hiding place buried within the epitaph is nothing less than a way of selecting the practical successor of the Ushiromiya family."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Herdar isso seria equivalente a herdar a própria família Ushiromiya. ...Em outras palavras, o enigma contido no epitáfio que indica a localização do ouro não é nada mais do que selecionar o sucessor substancial da família Ushiromiya."

Umineko Project (UP): Even the Sengoku commander Hideyoshi admired, Toyotomi Hideyoshi, made his son‐in‐law Hidetsugu commit seppuku, but it was rumored that he might have done this to make Hideyori, who was his real son and born after Hidetsugu, his true heir.

PC Japanese (JP): 秀吉が憧れる戦国武将、豊臣秀吉も、養子の秀次を切腹させているが、これは、秀次より後に生まれた実子、秀頼を真の後継者とするためだったのではないかと囁かれている。
Russian (RU): Даже командующий периода Сэнгоку, которым восхищался Хидэёши — Тоётоми Хидэёши, заставил своего зятя Хидэцугу совершить харакири, но ходили слухи, что он сделал так, чтобы сделать своим истинным преемником Хидэёри — его настоящего сына, родившегося после Хидэцугу.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 秀吉憧憬的戰國武將，豐臣秀吉，也曾命養子秀次切腹。這一件事被人們傳言，是否是為了令在秀次之後出生的親生兒子——秀賴成為真正的後繼人所做。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 秀吉憧憬的战国武将，丰臣秀吉，也曾命养子秀次切腹。这一件事被人们传言，是否是为了令在秀次之后出生的亲生儿子——秀赖成为真正的后继人所做。

Umineko Project (UP): ......In other words, naming a successor was a way to make it known to the world that a given single, unique person would be acknowledged by everyone as the successor, and a way to remove any chance of another person becoming an opposing candidate.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......In other words, naming a successor was a way to make it generally known that a single, unique person would be acknowledged by everyone as the successor, and a way to remove any chance of another person becoming an opposing candidate.
PC Japanese (JP): ……つまり、後継者指名とは、後継者は誰もが認める唯一無二の一人であると全体に知らしめ、それ以外の人物が対立候補となる要素全てを排除することも意味する。
Russian (RU): ......Иначе говоря, обозначение преемника — способ сделать общеизвестным то, что единственный, уникальный человек всеми признан преемником, а также способ исключить все шансы другого человека стать противостоящим кандидатом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Em outras palavras, nomear um sucessor é uma forma de tornar de conhecimento do mundo que há uma única, e apenas uma pessoa que será reconhecida por todos como sucessor, e uma maneira de eliminar todas as chances de outra pessoa se tornar um candidato opositor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……總而言之，指名後繼人，既是向所有人公告，後繼人乃是人人認同獨一無二的僅此一位的，也意味著，排除一切除此之外的人物成為對立候選人的要素。

Umineko Project (UP): I seemed to be regaining my balance the more I calmed down.
Steam (ST): It seems that I regain my equilibrium the more I calm down.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seems that I gain my equilibrium more the more I calm down.
PC Japanese (JP): 落ち着けば落ち着くほどに体は安定するようだ。
Russian (RU): Кажется, чем больше я успокаиваюсь, тем лучше могу удерживать равновесие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parece que quanto mais recupero meu equilíbrio, mais calmo vou ficando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 越是鎮靜下來，身體就越穩。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 越是镇静下来，身体就越稳。

Umineko Project (UP): Gradually, that weird floating feeling, like I was falling forever, began to disappear.
Steam (ST): Gradually, that weird floating feeling, like I was falling forever, began to disappear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Gradually, that weird floating feeling, like I was falling forever, began to disappear.
PC Japanese (JP): 次第に、どこまでも落下するような、気持ち悪い浮遊感は少しずつなくなる。
Russian (RU): Постепенно то странное плавучее чувство, будто я падаю в вечность, стало исчезать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gradualmente, a estranha sensação de estar flutuando, como se estivesse em uma queda infinita, começou a desaparecer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 漸漸的，那股沒完沒了地往下掉的，令人犯噁心的浮游感一點一點地不見了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 渐渐的，那股没完没了地往下掉的，令人犯恶心的浮游感一点一点地不见了。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It still felt strange, like struggling to stand upright at the bottom of a deep pool, but it was much better than before.
Steam (ST): ...It still felt strange, like trying to stand up straight at the bottom of a deep pool, but it was much better than before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It still felt strange, like trying to stand up straight at the bottom of a deep pool, but it was much better than before.
PC Japanese (JP): ……まだ、深いプールの底で直立しようともがくような不快感はあるが、さっきよりははるかにマシだった。
Russian (RU): ......Всё казалось не таким и напоминало попытку встать на дно глубокого бассейна, но было уже гораздо лучше, чем ранее.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ainda era estranho, como lutar para ficar de pé em uma piscina muito funda, mas já estava melhor do que antes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……另外，儘管還是有著恰似身處深深的游泳池底掙扎著想站直的那種不快感，但比起剛才，要好得多得多。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……另外，尽管还是有着恰似身处深深的游泳池底挣扎着想站直的那种不快感，但比起刚才，要好得多得多。

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Then let's begin. .........I'll weave a fragment for solving the riddle of the epitaph......"
Steam (ST): "......Then let's begin. ......I'll weave together some Fragments for solving the riddle of the epitaph..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Then let's begin. .........I'll grab a Fragment for solving the riddle of the epitaph......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………では、始めるわ。………碑文の謎を解くためのカケラを紡ぐ……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………では、始めるわ。………碑文の謎を解くためのカケラを紡ぐ……」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Muito bem, vamos começar. .........Irei tecer um Fragmento para resolver o enigma do epitáfio......"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………那么，开始了哦。………编织为解开碑文之谜所需的碎片……」

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Bernkastel} opened both of her hands.
Steam (ST): {f:5:Bernkastel} opened both of her hands.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Bernkastel opened both of her hands.
PC Japanese (JP): ベルンカステルが、両手を左右に開く。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Бернкастель} раскрыла обе руки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Bernkastel} abriu ambas as mãos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝倫卡斯泰露向左右張開雙手。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝伦卡斯泰露向左右张开双手。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, like a planetarium.........all of the fragments throughout this empty space began to spin, leaving tails behind them...
Steam (ST): Then, like a planetarium, ...all of the Fragments throughout this empty space began to spin, leaving tails behind them...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, like a planetarium.........all of the Fragments throughout this empty space began to spin, leaving tails behind them...
PC Japanese (JP): すると、まるでプラネタリウムのように、………全宇宙のカケラが、尾を引いて回り始めた…。
Russian (RU): И тут, как в планетарии......... все фрагменты в этой пустоте завертелись, оставляя за собой следы...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E assim, como se fosse um planetário.........toda criação de Fragmentos ao longo deste espaço vazio começaram a girar, deixando para trás uma cauda atrás dos mesmos...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，簡直就像天象儀一般，………全宇宙的碎片拖著尾巴旋轉了起來…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，简直就像天象仪一般，………全宇宙的碎片拖着尾巴旋转了起来…。

Umineko Project (UP): The expression "planetarium" might have been even more fitting than I thought...
Steam (ST): The expression "planetarium" might've been surprisingly fitting...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The expression 'planetarium' might have been even more fitting...
PC Japanese (JP): プラネタリウムという表現は、本当に正しかったかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Слово 'планетарий' подходит даже больше...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A expressão "planetário" acabou se encaixando melhor do que imaginei...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 天象儀這個比喻，也許真的準確無誤吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 天象仪这个比喻，也许真的准确无误吧。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Multiple fragments were tied together by gold lines, and what looked like constellations zoomed by us rapidly, one after another.
Steam (ST): ...Multiple Fragments were tied together by gold lines, and what looked like constellations zoomed by us rapidly, one after another.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Multiple Fragments were tied together by gold lines, and what looked like constellations zoomed by us rapidly, one after another.
PC Japanese (JP): ……なぜなら、複数のカケラが金色の線で結ばれた、まるで星座のようなものが、次々に高速で俺たちの周りを飛び抜けていくからだ。
Russian (RU): ......Множество фрагментов были связаны между собой золотыми линиями, и рядом с нами стремительно увеличивались подобия созвездий.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Múltiplos Fragmentos estavam interligados por fios de ouro, e aquilo que aparentava ser uma constelação se aproximou de nós em alta velocidade, seguida de outra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……要問為什麼的話，這是因為，複數的碎片被金色的線連在一起，猶如星座的玩意一個接一個地高速飛過我們的身邊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……要问为什么的话，这是因为，复数的碎片被金色的线连在一起，犹如星座的玩意一个接一个地高速飞过我们的身边。

Umineko Project (UP): It felt almost as though we were dashing through space at an incredible speed...
Steam (ST): It felt almost as though we were dashing through space at an incredible speed...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It felt almost as though we were dashing through space at an incredible speed...
PC Japanese (JP): それはまるで、俺たち３人がものすごい速度で、宇宙を駆け抜けているかのようだった…。
Russian (RU): Мы словно мчались на невероятной скорости сквозь пространство...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como se estivéssemos correndo através do espaço a uma incrível velocidade...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 簡直就像是，我們三人在以駭人的速度橫穿宇宙一般…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 简直就像是，我们三人在以骇人的速度横穿宇宙一般…。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, with tails of light drifting behind them, ......several brightly glowing fragments swirled around {f:5:Bernkastel}.
Steam (ST): Then, with tails of light drifting behind them, ...several brightly glowing Fragments swirled around {f:5:Bernkastel}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, with tails of light drifting behind them, ......several brightly glowing Fragments swirled around Bernkastel.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、いくつかの強く輝くカケラが、光の尾を引きながら、……ベルンカステルを中心に渦を巻くように取り込まれていく。
Russian (RU): Затем, оставляя за собой световые следы...... вокруг {f:5:Бернкастель} закружилось несколько ярко сверкающих фрагментов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, com caudas de luz à deriva por trás deles, ......numerosos Fragmentos de brilho reluzente rodopiaram ao redor de {f:5:Bernkastel}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，一些閃耀著強勁光輝的碎片，邊拖著光之尾，……邊如同以貝倫卡斯泰露為中心，捲起了旋渦般地被吸了過來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，一些闪耀着强劲光辉的碎片，边拖着光之尾，……边如同以贝伦卡斯泰露为中心，卷起了旋涡般地被吸了过来。

Umineko Project (UP): It looked almost like she had created her own solar system with her as the sun.
Steam (ST): It looked almost like she'd created her own solar system, with her as the sun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It looked almost like she had created her own solar system with her as the sun.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que ela havia criado seu próprio sistema solar, tendo ela mesma assumido a posição de sol.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 看起来甚至就像是，她就是太阳，她创造出了自己的太阳系。

Umineko Project (UP): That solar system surrounding {f:5:Bernkastel} grew to a radius large enough to swallow us up.
Steam (ST): That solar system surrounding {f:5:Bernkastel} grew to a radius large enough to swallow us up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That solar system surrounding Bernkastel grew to a radius large enough to swallow us up.

Russian (RU): Солнечная система, окружающая {f:5:Бернкастель}, настолько увеличилась в радиусе, что могла бы поглотить нас.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O raio desse sistema solar que cercava {f:5:Bernkastel} cresceu de tal forma que nos engoliu.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个以贝伦卡斯泰露为中心的太阳系，半径渐渐大到了将我们吞于其中。

Steam (ST): And every once in a while, one of those satellite Fragments zoomed right past me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And every once in a while, one of those satellite Fragments zoomed right past me.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): After drawing a spiral and approaching her, it settled down on the palm of Bernkastel's outstretched hand...
PC Japanese (JP): ぐるぐると渦を描きながら近付き、ベルンカステルが差し出した手の平の上に、すっと載った…。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...The 'beloved hometown' definitely won't betray our expectations. ......The only past that Father held dear was his years as a boy."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I remember that. ...This is when, in the third game, Auntie Eva was just about to solve the riddle of the epitaph, and was thinking it over with this witch inside her or whatever."
Steam (ST): "......I remember that. ...This is from the 3rd game, when Aunt Eva was just about to solve the riddle of the epitaph...and was thinking it over with this witch inside her or whatever."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........I remember that. ...This is when, in the 3rd game, Eva oba-san was just about to solve the riddle of the epitaph, and was thinking it over with this witch inside her or whatever."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………覚えてるぜ。…これは第３のゲームで、絵羽伯母さんが碑文の謎を解く直前にしていた、自分の中の魔女とやらとの考察だ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………覚えてるぜ。…これは第３のゲームで、絵羽伯母さんが碑文の謎を解く直前にしていた、自分の中の魔女とやらとの考察だ」
Russian (RU): ".........Я это помню. ...Третья игра, тётя Ева была близка к разгадке эпитафии и раздумывала над ней с той ведьмой в себе."

Steam (ST): Erika and {f:5:Bernkastel}'s logic is extremely reasonable.

Umineko Project (UP): He was probably alive at the time the epitaph was displayed, but of course, ......he's already dead by 1986.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): He was probably alive at the time the epitaph was displayed, but of course, ......Grandfather is already dead by 1986.

Umineko Project (UP): And, in the games up until now, {f:5:Beatrice} threatened us repeatedly with letters, saying that the only way to survive was to solve the epitaph, and trying to force us to solve the riddle.
Steam (ST): And, in the games up until now, {f:5:Beatrice} threatened us repeatedly with letters, saying that the only way to survive was to solve the epitaph... and trying to force us to solve the riddle.

PC Japanese (JP): そして、これまでのゲームで何度も、ベアトリーチェは手紙で、碑文を解く以外に生き残る道はない、というような脅迫を繰り返し、謎解きに挑戦しろと強要してくる。
Russian (RU): И в предыдущих играх {f:5:Беатриче} неоднократно угрожала нам письмами, говоря, что единственный способ выжить — это разгадать эпитафию, и заставляя нас разгадывать эту загадку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E, durante os jogos até agora, a {f:5:Beatrice} nos ameaçou repetidamente com cartas, dizendo que a única forma de sobreviver era resolvendo o epitáfio, e tentou nos forçar a resolver o enigma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 其次，在之前的那幾盤遊戲中，貝阿朵莉切曾多次通過信，反反覆覆地威脅我們“除解開碑文外，沒有別的生路”，強迫我們挑戰解謎。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 其次，在之前的那几盘游戏中，贝阿朵莉切曾多次通过信，反反复复地威胁我们“除解开碑文外，没有别的生路”，强迫我们挑战解谜。

Steam (ST): In other words, ...it was {f:5:Beatrice}'s intention—her hope—that we would try solving the riddle of the epitaph.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, ......it was Beatrice's intention, ...her hope......that we would try solving the riddle of the epitaph.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, ......era a intenção da {f:5:Beatrice}, ...sua esperança......de que tentaríamos resolver o enigma do epitáfio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這也就代表著，……“去挑戰碑文之謎吧”，乃是貝阿朵莉切的想法，……與期望。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这也就代表着，……“去挑战碑文之谜吧”，乃是贝阿朵莉切的想法，……与期望。

Umineko Project (UP): The epitaph is so confusing that, in most cases, the relatives never seriously tried solving it until the threatening letters started to arrive.
Steam (ST): The epitaph's so confusing that, in most cases, the relatives never seriously tried solving it until the threatening letters started to arrive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The epitaph is so confusing that, in most cases, the relatives never seriously tried solving it until the threatening letters started to arrive.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於過於難解，所以至少在恐嚇信送來之前，大多數情況下，親族們是不會去認真推理的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于过于难解，所以至少在恐吓信送来之前，大多数情况下，亲族们是不会去认真推理的。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "......Right. "Must journey to the Golden Land", it says. Apparently, this made Aunt Rosa picture setting off on a journey from the beloved home of old to the Golden Land, a journey lasting until the tenth twilight, or in other words, ten days."
Steam (ST): "...Yeah. You've gotta travel to the Golden Land, right? Apparently, this made Aunt Rosa think about the tenth twilight... in other words, going on a ten-day journey from the beloved homeland to the Golden Land..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Yeah. You should travel to the Golden Land, right? Apparently, this made Rosa oba-san think about the tenth twilight... in other words, going on a ten-day journey from the beloved homeland to the Golden Land..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……あぁ。黄金郷へ旅立つべし、だろ？　楼座叔母さんは、第十の晩、即ち、十日を掛けて、懐かしき故郷から黄金郷へ向けて、旅に出る……、ということを連想したらしい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……あぁ。黄金郷へ旅立つべし、だろ？　楼座叔母さんは、第十の晩、即ち、十日を掛けて、懐かしき故郷から黄金郷へ向けて、旅に出る……、ということを連想したらしい」
Russian (RU): ".....Так вот. В Золотую Землю ведь нужно отправиться? Из‐за этого тётя Роза задумалась о десятых сумерках... О десятидневном путешествии от любимой родины до Золотой Земли..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Certo. Diz "Deve seguir a seguinte ordem para chegar à Terra Dourada.". Ao que pareceu, a tia Rosa visualizou isso como sendo uma jornada da amada cidade passada até a Terra Dourada, uma jornada que vai até o décimo crepúsculo, ou em outras palavras, dez dias."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……啊——。它是說，踏上黃金鄉之旅吧？樓座姑母好象是從此聯想到了，出發踏上到第十晚，即，歷經十天的，從懷念的故鄉到黃金鄉的……，旅途。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……啊——。它是说，踏上黄金乡之旅吧？楼座姑母好象是从此联想到了，出发踏上到第十晚，即，历经十天的，从怀念的故乡到黄金乡的……，旅途。」
